Title:
Tuber brennemanii and Tuber floridanum: Two New Tuber species
(Pezizales, Ascomycota) are Among the Most Commonly Detected
Ectomycorrhizal Taxa Within Commercial Pecan (Carya illinoinensis)
Orchards
Keywords:
Key words: agriculture, biodiversity, truffles, Tuberaceae
Tuber, pecan ectomycorrhiza,
Abstract:
“Truffles” are sequestrate hypogeous fungi and most form
ectomycorrhizal (ECM) associations with trees. True truffles in the
family Tuberaceae (Pezizales, Ascomycota) have been found on
phylogenetically diverse native trees and on the roots of economically
important crops such as pecan (Carya illinoinensis). Although Tuber
spp.
